title: Upcoming DeepSeek AI model failed to train using Huawei's chips

raw_body:
Article URL: https://arstechnica.com/ai/2025/08/deepseek-delays-next-ai-model-due-to-poor-performance-of-chinese-made-chips/
Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=44918317
Points: 1

speedrun: DeepSeek's upcoming AI model is delayed due to poor performance from Huawei's chips, highlighting significant challenges in using Chinese technology for advanced AI development. This setback raises concerns about the reliability of domestic chip manufacturing in the AI sector.
why_it_matters: The delay underscores the risks associated with reliance on specific hardware suppliers, potentially impacting timelines for AI advancements and innovations.
It may prompt companies to reconsider their hardware partnerships, influencing the competitive landscape in the AI industry and possibly accelerating the shift towards alternative chip manufacturers.

lenses.eli12: DeepSeek, a company working on AI, is having trouble because the chips made by Huawei aren't good enough for their new model. This is important because it shows that not all technology is equally effective, and it might slow down new AI developments that could help everyone.
lenses.pm: DeepSeek's AI model is aimed at researchers and businesses needing advanced AI solutions. The chip performance issues hinder development speed, creating an opportunity for competitors with better hardware. Companies may face risks in project delays and increased costs, pushing them to seek more reliable chip suppliers.
lenses.engineer: DeepSeek's model relies on high-performance computing, which is critical for training AI effectively. The failure of Huawei's chips indicates limitations in processing power and efficiency, which could lead to slower training times. This situation highlights the need for robust hardware solutions in AI development, as any constraints can significantly impact overall performance.
